msItem.rubric: Name of the protagonist; a few lines alternating with black lines on the incipit pages of Texts I and II; incipits of miracles; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

msItem.colophon: Colophon 1: fol. 53va-vb. Fol. 53va: ለዘ፡ ጸሐፎ፡ ወለዘ፡ አጽሐፎ፡ ወለዘ፡ አንበቦ፡ ወለዘ፡ ሰምዐ፡ … ተፈጸመ፡ በዝየ፡ ገድለ፡ አቡነ፡ ገ[fol. 53vb]ብረ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ … ለጸሐፊሃ፡ ገብረ፡ ማርያም፡ <…> ዘአጽሐፋ፡ አቡነ፡ ገብ<…> The note mentions the scribe Gäbrä Maryam and the commissioner ʾabunä Gäb<…>, whose name however remains only party readable. At the end, infact, the line with part of his name and some more have been erased. The note mentions the commissioner of the Ms. Fǝre Mikaʾel, from the relatives of Fälägä Śǝnnay and Maraḥe Ḥǝwät, and tells the story “how our Lord selected the children of this place (däqiqä zatti mäkan) who commissioned the miracles of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus”. In this story, the Martyrs of Ṗäraqliṭos (sämaʿtatä Ṗäraqliṭos), from Tiberias (Ṭǝ[bǝ]ryados), number of which was 777, are the protagonists. Some passages of the note have been erased and others are partly readable.

Colophon 2: fols. 68va-69vb. Fol. 68va: ተፈጸመ፡ በዝየ፡ ተአምረ፡ አቡነ፡ ገብረ፡ [መንፈስ፡]ቅዱስ፡ በከመ፡ ኀረዮ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ገብረ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ከማሁ፡ ሕረዮሙ፡[sic] እግዚእነ፡ ለደቂቀ፡ ዛቲ፡ መካን፡ እለ፡ አጽሐፉ፡ ተአምሪሁ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ገብረ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ … [fol. 68vb] አጽሐፍክዋ፡ አነ፡ ፍሬ፡ ሚካኤል፡ እምኣዝማዲሆሙ፡ ለፈለገ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወማራሔ፡ ሕይወት፡ ወይምጻእ፡ ብርሃን፡ በመዋዕለ፡ ዚአሆሙ፡ መጽኡ፡ ሰማዕታተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ እምጥርያዶስ፡ እለ፡ … The note mentions the scribe Gäbrä Maryam and the commissioner ʾabunä Gäb<…>, whose name however remains only party readable. At the end, infact, the line with part of his name and some more have been erased. The note mentions the commissioner of the Ms. Fǝre Mikaʾel, from the relatives of Fälägä Śǝnnay and Maraḥe Ḥǝwät, and tells the story “how our Lord selected the children of this place (däqiqä zatti mäkan) who commissioned the miracles of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus”. supportDesc.condition: The front board is missing; one fol. and half covered by a textile have the function to replace it. The original sewing is for the most part missing. The Ms. has been resewn with recent threads. A few folios are misplaced (e.g., fol. 9), some are possibly missing (e.g., between fol. 8v and fol. 10r). Several fols. are damaged at the edges; fol. 1r is for the most part destroyed, a part of the text is lost. Many fols. are affected by humidity.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
One line (or two lines) was not used by the scribe at the bottom of several fols. (e.g., fols. 11rv, 14rv, 15v-20v).

handDesc.handNote: Mediocre, irregular. Black; red (vivid vermillion). Gäbrä MaryamGäbrä Maryam is mentioned as the scribe on fol. 54rb (colophon 1).17th century (?)
The handwriting is characterized by right-sloping letters with rounded and curved shapes (e.g., ወ በ), with a few others more angular (e.g., መ ዐ).
- ጵ has the 6th order marker set up on the vertical stroke at the top, oriented to the left (e.g., fol. 2vb l.11)
- መ, in the 4 order, has the loops not completely separated (e.g., fol. 10va l.1)
- መ, ሠ, በ ወ have the tops slanted to the left
- ፮ is with the loop open, looking like “compressed” ፯ (e.g., fol. 12va l.3)
- ፪ has the loops closed, not separated
- ፬ is triangular, downwords oriented (e.g., fol. 57rb).
- sentence dividers are accompanied by the paragraph signs.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 1r (incipit page of Text I): simple, coloured (red, yellow, black, white) ornamental frame; interlaces and geometric motifs.
Fol. 54r (incipit page of Text II): simple, coloured (red, yellow, black, white) ornamental band with three lateral pendants reaching the middle of the text; interlaces and geometric motifs.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the front one is missing); remains of brown leather cover (turn-ins) have been preserved on the back board. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Traces of blind tooled ornament are visible on the outer part of the back cover.
